original: Typhoid fever, caused by the Salmonella typhi bacteria, became a concern in the early 20th century. Typhoid Mary, an infamous case, was a carrier of the disease without exhibiting any symptoms herself. She worked as a cook and unknowingly infected numerous individuals with the bacteria. It was through her lack of proper hygiene practices and contamination of food that Typhoid Mary exposed others t
